page.title: 06 NEWTON KYME continued
page.content:
In the church there is a small sculpture of John Fairfax's head (a notable family in this area), which was made in 1613. There are no new grave stones and the church is very much smaller than Wighill Church.
Elizabeth the First's Coronation was arranged by the Vicar of Newton Kyme. In return she made him Bishop of Carlistle.
The small school which was given by the Fairfax's in l767 was closed after the second world war and is now a residence. The vicarage, a large imposing building used to be used as a sort of school, where the local gentry's boys were crammed for public schools.
